abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Alexandria Water Supply
            Project for Egypt was cancelled on January 2, 1990, at the
            request of the Government of Egypt. The Borrower was
            concerned about its foreign exchange risk in borrowing from
            the Bank, and was able to secure several grants to cover a
            substantial part of the needed foreign exchange. Prior to
            cancellation, the project also suffered initial delays due
            to the Bank not receiving adequate external debt data, a
            condition of loan signing. This was resolved in May 1989,
            but the legal documents were never signed. The Ministry of
            Economy and International Cooperation and the Ministry of
            Finance caused other delays during 1989.
